answers.answer: I think it's best you go to a doctor first to see exactly what it is.  The reason being is because I, too, have what I think is a yeast infection, and I've used otc products, but they are helping nonwhatsoever.  We think we should know the signs and symptoms of a yeast infection, but it could be something altogether different.  So that's why it's best to let the doctor look at you.  Also, if your yeast infections are recurrent, you may want to be checked for diabetes because they say that's one of the signs of diabetes.

Hi,I definitly think you should go to the Dr for this problem, b/c i don't think otc stuff works to great either.  It could very well be a bacterial infection.  The symtoms of bladder infections are urinating frequently, backache, possibly blood in urine.  The symtoms of a yeast infection are Very itchy, white clumpy discharge, smells like yeast.  Bacterial infections are whitish discharge, smells like fish, can make you feel terrible.  Sometimes you can cure a yeast infection otc, but i've never been able too, so i agree that you see a dr asap!

hi, i went to the docs yesterday coz i had a yeast infection. She gave me a tablet and it has gone already. I do advise u 2c ur doctor tho just to be sure.They may be able to give you one thing that treats both. x

question: I am pretty sure I have a UTI, they are reoccuring and I have had them before. But I also think I might have a yeast infection, I have all the symptoms of both. Is it possible for one to cause or trigger the other? What would my best treatments be? I would like to do over the counter or obtain a prescription. Im not sure I want to see my doctor, I just did for my yearly, had my pap and was tested, so I am pretty confident its not an STD. I did just finish my period about a week ago and the symptoms came about soon after.How good does cranberry suppliements( im not a big fan of drinking the juice) work? Also should I go on antibiotics, and hope it helps both or treat each seperatly over the counter? Any recommendations?Thanks!
title: UTI and Yeast Infection?
